greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that (44^n - 1)/43 is prime.
comment: Number corresponding to a(4) is a probable prime.
These are the indices of base-44 repunit primes, i.e., numbers n such that A002275(n) interpreted as base-44 number and converted to decimal is prime. - _Felix Fröhlich_, Nov 08 2017
mathematica: ParallelMap[ If[ PrimeQ[(44^# - 1)/43], #, Nothing] &, Prime@Range @ 10000] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 25 2017 *)
results.author: _Paul Bourdelais_, Nov 07 2017
